org.jvault.vault

Interface Vault<P>

  • Type Parameters:
    P - The type of target to be injected beans, it was determined by the implementation of the Vault interface.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ClassVault, InstanceVault

    @API
public interface Vault<P>
    As a bean container, containing scanned Bean.
    Inject beans to parameter and returns an instance of the parameter

    Vault can select classes and packages that can be passed as parameters.
    If no classes and packages are selected, all classes and packages can be passed as parameters.

    Vault can only be instantiated in the org.jvault.* package,
    and actually you can't force instantiation of Vault without using Reflection.
    This means that you should not instantiate Vault using Reflection.
    To obtain Vault, see VaultFactory interface.
    Since:
    0.1
    Author:
    devxb
    See Also:
    ClassVault, VaultFactory, Inject, InternalBean

      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Vault.Builder<S> 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      <R> R inject(P injectTarget, java.lang.Class<R> returnType)
      Method of injecting beans into parameter.

    • Method Detail

      • inject

        <R> R inject(P injectTarget,
             java.lang.Class<R> returnType)
        Method of injecting beans into parameter.
        The package of parameter is included in the package list with access to the vault,
        and the injection succeeds only if the accesses paths of bean contains the package of param.

        Vault reads the declared @Inject in the param object and injects the corresponding beans,
        where the accesses of the beans must contain the package path of the param.

        If the param object is marked with @InternalBean,
        it finds the corresponding Bean in the Beans stored inside the Vault and returns an instance of param,
        or if not, it creates a new instance of param, injects the required Bean, and returns an instance of param.
        Type Parameters:
        R - The type of return instance
        Parameters:
        injectTarget - The type of target to be injected beans, Vault will inject beans into the param.
        returnType - The class-type to be returned. This must be a type that matches the param parameter.
        Returns:
        Returns an instance of the type received param.
        Throws:
        DisallowedAccessException - Occurs when the package or class passed to param, that does not have access to Vault, or the Beans to be injected into param cannot be injected package or class to Param.
        Since:
        0.1
        See Also:
        Inject, InternalBean, DisallowedAccessException
